title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1272 - Safety
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1272 - Safety

State Regulations
§ 1272.1 - Acts of commission or omission endangering person or property prohibited
§ 1272.2 - Smoking or carrying naked flame restricted
§ 1272.3 - Operation of cutting torches and like devices restricted
§ 1272.4 - Open fires restricted
§ 1272.5 - Storage, use or transportation of explosives and other dangerous substances restricted
§ 1272.6 - Permission required for storage, handling or loading explosives or other dangerous articles barred by Federal regulations
§ 1272.7 - Storage, handling or transportation of atomic weapons prohibited
§ 1272.8 - Storage, handling or transportation of radioactive materials restricted
§ 1272.9 - Heating of engines to be by approved means only
§ 1272.10 - Use of fire extinguishing equipment restricted
§ 1272.11 - Use of terminal equipment and machinery restricted

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 21, ch. XXIV, subch. D, art. 2, pt. 1272

Statutory authority: N.Y. Laws 1921, ch. 154, art. VI and
N.J. Laws 1921, ch. 151, consented to by Congress 42 U.S. Stat. 174 [1921]; N.Y. Laws 1922, ch. 43 and N.J. Laws 1922, ch. 9, consented to by Congress 42
U.S. Stat. 822 [1922]
State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
